row.Docu:
= RB name = PCK.AUTOMIC_MSSQL.PUB.ACTION.CREATE_DB
= General description = Creates a specified database.
= Inputs = * SQL User: The username used for authentication * SQL Password: The password used for authentication * JDBC Connection String: JDBC connection string. E.g.: jdbc:sqlserver://myServer:1433;databaseName=myDB * JDBC Driver JAR URI: URI pointing to the vendor-specific JDBC jar-file. E.g 'file:///C:/Automic/Agents/windows/bin/sqljdbc4.jar' * JDBC Driver Class: Name of the class to load when initializing the JDBC connection. E.g "com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver" * Connection Interval: Time interval in seconds during which ARATools.jar tries to establish a connection to the database. * Number of Connection Retries: The number that is specified in this parameter determines how often ARATools.jar tries to connect to the database. After the nth failure, the ARATools ends with a failure code. * Database to Create: The name of the database to create * Filespec: Controls the file properties. For more details on the syntax/semantics of the filespec, please consult http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms179316.aspx * Filegroupspec: Controls if the filegroupspec entry should be generated in the SQL statement. * Log: Controls the log file properties. * Fail if DB exists: if set to yes, the script will fail if the database is already existing. * Thrustworthy: Controls external access to and from the database. * DB chaining: Controls external access to and from the database.
= Behavior = Return 0 if database is created successfully. Return 999 (with SQL exception) if failed because of any exception getting from SQL server. If the database already exist and "Fail if DB exists" flag set to YES: Return 12 with properly exception "Fail if DB exists" flag set to NO: Return 0 but still message the object existed Return 4 for other failure = Outputs = None
= Rollback = None
= Logging = None
= Example = None
